channel.title: Permission-hardener failed
channel.description:
Hi! I am trying to upgrade my server, but permission hardener failed. Here is the error message:
``` permission-hardener: [ERROR]: File has unexpected hardlinks, cannot handle. File name: '/etc/group' File name from stat: '/etc/group' line: '/usr/sbin/ nosuid'
/var/lib/dpkg/info/security-misc.postinst: ERROR: Permission hardening failed.
```
What should I do?

item.title: Permission-hardener failed
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
What’s the realpath?

/etc/group normally isn’t a hard link. And without knowing the realpath, I have no idea how to investigate what’s causing that.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: SteveK1978
item.description:
Patrick:

chmod-calc /etc/group

The result of the server with problem:

# chmod-calc /etc/group
Permissions for: '/etc/group'
Type: Hardlink
Owner: root
Group: root
Octal Permissions: 644
File Size: 815 bytes
Link Count: 2
Hidden File: No
ACLs: none
Extended Attributes: none
Capabilities: None
Immutable (chattr +i): No

Symlink: No

Parent Folder Symlink: No

Category   Read   Write  Execute 
Owner      Yes    Yes    No      
Group      Yes    No     No      
Public     Yes    No     No      

Special Attributes:
SUID: Not Set
SGID: Not Set
Sticky Bit: Not Set

After I did:

# cp -ra /etc/group ~ && rm -rf /etc/group && cp -ra ~/group /etc/group

The `chmod-calc` output between the problematic server and normal server are the same:

# chmod-calc /etc/group
Permissions for: '/etc/group'
Type: Regular File
Owner: root
Group: root
Octal Permissions: 644
File Size: 815 bytes
Link Count: 1
Hidden File: No
ACLs: none
Extended Attributes: none
Capabilities: None
Immutable (chattr +i): No

Symlink: No

Parent Folder Symlink: No

Category   Read   Write  Execute 
Owner      Yes    Yes    No      
Group      Yes    No     No      
Public     Yes    No     No      

Special Attributes:
SUID: Not Set
SGID: Not Set
Sticky Bit: Not Set

But after I install a random package with apt, the old issue pops up and /etc/group become a hardlink again.

item.title: Permission-hardener failed
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Something uncommon about your file /etc/group.

For debugging:

ls -la /etc/group

And.

realpath /etc/group

And.

chmod-calc /etc/group

(chmod-calc)

Ideally, compare that to system without that issue.

Read full topic
